sen.j: 出自については不明だが、織田信長に仕え、永禄3年（1560年）、桶狭間の戦いでは負傷した服部一忠を助け、今川義元の首を挙げた。
sen.e: His origin is not known, but he served Nobunaga ODA and, in 1560 in the Battle of Okehazama, he helped Kazutada HATTORI, who had been injured, and beheaded Yoshimoto IMAGAWA.

sen.j: その功により、のちに黒母衣衆のひとりとなったが、信長上洛後は大河内城攻め、甲州攻めなどでは名があるが、あまりぱっとせず、吏僚的な活躍が多いため、一隊の長に昇ることなく信長の側近として旗本部隊に属した。
sen.e: As the reward for it, he was later promoted to a member of kurohoroshu (a group of selected warriors of Nobunaga ODA), but, after Nobunaga's visit to Kyoto, although his name was mentioned in records of the attack to Okochi-jo Castile and Invasion to Koshu, he did not have remarkable achievements and, because his worked mainly as an clerical staff, he was not promoted to a chief of a troop and belonged to a troop of the direct vassal to Nobunaga as close vassal.

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）、本能寺の変の際は京都に随行しており、信長の長子織田信忠を守って二条城に篭り、最期に黒母衣衆としての意地を見せ、奮戦して壮絶に討死した。
sen.e: In 1582 on the occasion of the Honnoji Incident, he had following Nobunaga to Kyoto and he stayed in the Nijo-jo Castle to guard Nobutada ODA, who was the heir of Nobunaga, and showed his pride as a kurohoroshu and fought bravely and died a hero.
